job_title: Pharmacy Purchaser/Pharmacy Technician/Inventory Manager in Orange City, FL
pros: A great company with a clear mission to take the best care of the residents of our community.
cons: Opportunities to grow in the company

pros: The residents and some of the co-workers-not all.
cons: When I worked there it seemed like the place was in shambles. They couldn't keep anybody and after working there I understood why. Employees were taken advantage of and I was never given my appropriate raise, and to even ask about it was like pulling teeth, yet when I said I was going to leave they didn't hesitate to offer me $2 more than what I originally asked for. The pay rates weren't fair. I worked almost 60 hours a week and still couldn't afford to live.

review_title: Alot of good people work here
job_title: Security Officer in Orange City, FL
pros: Steady work, enjoy our elderly residents
cons: Management is horrible and out of touch with the work load they require.

job_title: Senior Accountant in Orange City, FL
pros: Staff is great, residents are very nice.
cons: Severe lack of communication between management & employees. PTO very minimal

review_title: A Place lacking Vision for anything but $$$
job_title: Physical Therapist in Orange City, FL
pros: Nice buildings, property & location. Super nice Residents!
cons: Clueless Management who hide behind closed doors & only come out when they want to pontificate, control & bully. Very difficult place to work of you want to grow professionally

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Orange City, FL
pros: Overall a great place to work within the LTC setting. Clean environment and great teaching skills from the more experienced nurses; patience, demonstrative teaching, and confidence-building. Depending on the shift you work the pace changes, but in general this CCRC is a lovely one - the residents are great and the SNF building within the community has a positive, friendly vibe. Training here surpasses M/S Trauma hospital training I received over the course of a few months! When training at JKV after 4 days I was on the floor, with resources if I needed help and great staff to rely on.
cons: Sometimes short-staffed, but generally better patient ratios than other SNF/CCRC facilities. Work-life balance can be a challenge if full-time (which is not rare in this industry).

job_title: Registered Nurse in Orange City, FL
cons: Pay, lack of benefits, management, administration. Joe Traynor is clueless.

pros: I worked at John Knox Orange City Florida has the Medicare case manager exceptional community and continuum care facilities.

job_title: Life Enrichment Assistant in Orange City, FL
pros: Nice staff, lenient administrative, freedom. You get Christmas bonus every year. Nice facility. Guaranteed almost always free food at least once a week for all staff.
cons: A lot of work considering the pay you get.  Be prepared to be on your feet all day.  Mistakes are not taken lightly. Always short staffed.

review_title: Loved the job, not the pay
job_title: Activities Assistant Med Center in Tampa, FL
pros: Co-workers are friendly and supportive. The residents despite their state of mind are lovable once you get to know them.  A lot of creativity, the job itself it fairly fun.
cons: It takes a lot out of you not just physically but emotionally as well but the pay doesn't reflect that. A barista (tbh) gets paid more to make a cup of joe than us and we are required to do so much more.  they expect a lot of things but not much of training not even a guideline to look at, the person who is doing the training isn't fully trained either. They can't keep staff because of the pay and just how upper management treats them.

pros: GREAT pay/benefit package.  New insurance is even better than previous.  We have a nurse practitioner that we can see at NO COST.  Pharmacy right on property and they offer discounted prescriptions to employees.  Nice work environment.  Supportive management.  Great residents.  Great place to camp out during a hurricane WITH your family and pets!  They provide free food and entertainment during hurricane AND free childcare.   Fitness center.  Retirement plan with match.  Great care to residents.  Lots of room for growth and learning opportunities.
cons: There are a few negative Nancy's working here.  Looks like some posted here.  :)

pros: Some co-workers extremely nice.  Will work around schedule if going to school.  Great deal of satisfaction working with and for the residents.
cons: Hired per diem resulting in no benefits but worked full time hours. Supervisor played favorites, letting them choose first the residents they requested to work with and did nothing when some employees complained.  Held meetings that were supposed to be mandatory, but if some didn't show up, let it slide.  Poor pay.  Early employees ate lunch free, employees on later shift had to bring food or pay in excess of $10.00.  No breaks. No benefits.

pros: 0 . Management doesn't acknowledemployees or address any issues.?Hope you don't need to be respected or value. The human Resource dept will screw up your benefits
cons: Employees are hostile and trained not to assist each other.. Management doesn't work holidays or weekends but employees with 20 years with the company can't get days off for life events submitted weeks ahead

review_title: I experienced alot of empathy and sadness working at john knox.
pros: John Knox is fast a paced work enviroment good for someone who wants to truely help and care for patients.
cons: John Knox is very under staffed as far as cna's. Patients get the brunt of this in lack of care or alwased rushed care.
